content: elanor beanie by ethan pyle 2 i wanted a simple hat for my newborn that would keep her head warm in our cold wisconsin winters and also have the flexibility to grow with her as she gets older nothing provides this kind of warmth and size flexibility like a good 2x2 ribbing so this simple hat was born with elevated details like a tubular cast-on and mirrored crown decreases this simple child s hat is a quick knit that will keep the head of the little one in your life warm and grow with them sizes newborn toddler 1-3 years child 3-5 years schematic finished measurements a - height un-stretched - 7 8 9 in 18 20 22 cm b - circumference un-stretched - 10 13 15 5 in 25 33 39 cm note on sizing the amount of stretch afforded by the 2x2 ribbing means that the sizing is somewhat flexible this hat in made with growing children in mind so the hat that fits your newborn with 1-2 inches of negative ease may still comfortably fit your two-year-old with 5-6 inches of negative ease you do want to plan for some negative ease so that the hat stays on comfortably without falling off gauge 34 sts x 30 row = 4in 10cm in 2x2 ribbing worked in the round un-stretched ©2022 refracted light fiber arts for personal use only www refractedlightfiberarts com | instagram @refractedlightfiberarts | refractedlightfiberarts@gmail com 3 yarn sample used autumn and indigo fibers - classic sock held double 75% sw merino wool/25% nylon 436 yds / 100g 162 yds / 36 g - for newborn size to substitute use 170 yds fingering weight yarn held double or approximately 90 yds dk weight yarn needles us 2 5 3 0mm 16in circular needles notions stitch marker tapestry needle abbreviations bor - beginning of round co - cast on k - knit k2tog - knit next two stitches together p - purl s - slip ssk - slip 2 stitches knitwise purl these 2 stitches together through the back loop st/sts - stitch/stitches wyib - with yarn in back wyif - with yarn in front ©2022 refracted light fiber arts for personal use only www refractedlightfiberarts com | instagram @refractedlightfiberarts | refractedlightfiberarts@gmail com 4 2x2 tubular cast on co the number of stitches directed by the pattern using the italian tubular cast-on check out this helpful tutorial italian tubular cast-on tutorial some people prefer to cast on and work the tubular rounds with needles one or two sizes smaller than for the rest of the project this is a matter of personal preference i have found that using the same size needles throughout gives me a tubular edge that i am happy with join to work in the round being careful not to twist the stitches and place beginning of round marker tubular round 1 *k1 s1wyif repeat from * to bor marker tubular round 2 *s1wyib p1 repeat from * to bor marker tubular round 3
